title: How Did Mother Sita Nurture Luv and Kush? | Sri Sampati Dasa
speaker: HG Satya Gaura Chandra Dasa

segments.text: If Sita was angry and upset with Shri Ram, why Ram abandoned me to forest?
She would have made love and kush feel against Shri Ram. This is not the truth.
If Sita was unhappy that why Ram abandoned me to forest just because some common people
are making some allegations against me. This is not the truth. She was not angry and upset
with Shri Ram's decision. It is visible the way she brought up love and kush. Love and
kush are the first Katha Vachaks. They are the first people to speak Ramayana, Valmiki
Ramayana. They were going everywhere, every village, nook and corner of Ayodhya and they
were singing the glories of Lord Shri.
If Sita was angry and upset with Shri Ram, with his decision, obviously she must have
poisoned the children of Shri Ram. She would have made love and kush feel against Shri
Ram. Rather, she made them learn the glories of Shri Ram. That shows that Sita always carried
love for Shri Ram. She understood the Dharma Sankat of Shri Ram. She was completely
okay with Ram's decision because she did not poison the minds of love and kush. Today
we see when there is fight between husband and wife and there is some kind of injustice
and there is divorce, sometimes the father tries to poison the minds of children against
the mother or mother tries to poison the children's mind against the father. But that's not the
case in Ramayana. Sita prepared love and kush to go and sing the greatness of Ram's character.
That is Ramayana. So love and kush, they never carried any grudge against their father
Shri Ram. They were very happy. They always felt that Ram is the greatest father. So that
is because Sita happily trained love and kush to sing the greatness of Lord Shri Ram.
